trans-unit.source: Managing the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server remotely by using the servlet interface

seg-source.mrk: Managing the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server remotely by using the servlet interface

target.mrk: Managing the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server remotely by using the servlet interface

trans-unit.source: You can use the servlet interface to manage the Network Server remotely. To use the servlet interface, the servlet must be registered with an Application Server, and <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> must be known to the Application Server.

seg-source.mrk: You can use the servlet interface to manage the Network Server remotely.
To use the servlet interface, the servlet must be registered with an Application Server, and <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> must be known to the Application Server.

target.mrk: You can use the servlet interface to manage the Network Server remotely.
To use the servlet interface, the servlet must be registered with an Application Server, and <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph> must be known to the Application Server.

trans-unit.source: The servlet interface is suitable only for testing purposes. It should not be used in production.

seg-source.mrk: The servlet interface is suitable only for testing purposes.
It should not be used in production.

target.mrk: The servlet interface is suitable only for testing purposes.
It should not be used in production.

trans-unit.source: A web application archive (WAR) file for the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server, <codeph>derby.war</codeph>, is available in <codeph>$<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/lib</codeph>. This file registers the Network Server's servlet at the relative path <codeph>/derbynet</codeph>. See the documentation for your Application Server for instructions on how to install it.

seg-source.mrk: A web application archive (WAR) file for the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server, <codeph>derby.war</codeph>, is available in <codeph>$<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/lib</codeph>.
This file registers the Network Server's servlet at the relative path <codeph>/derbynet</codeph>.
See the documentation for your Application Server for instructions on how to install it.

target.mrk: A web application archive (WAR) file for the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server, <codeph>derby.war</codeph>, is available in <codeph>$<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/lib</codeph>.
This file registers the Network Server's servlet at the relative path <codeph>/derbynet</codeph>.
See the documentation for your Application Server for instructions on how to install it.

trans-unit.source: For example, if <codeph>derby.war</codeph> is installed in WebSphere Application Server with a context root of <codeph>derby</codeph>, the URL of the server is:

seg-source.mrk: For example, if <codeph>derby.war</codeph> is installed in WebSphere Application Server with a context root of <codeph>derby</codeph>, the URL of the server is:

target.mrk: For example, if <codeph>derby.war</codeph> is installed in WebSphere Application Server with a context root of <codeph>derby</codeph>, the URL of the server is:

trans-unit.source: http://<server>[:port]/derby/derbynet

seg-source.mrk: http://<server>[:port]/derby/derbynet

target.mrk: http://<server>[:port]/derby/derbynet

trans-unit.source: Notes

seg-source.mrk: Notes

target.mrk: Notes

trans-unit.source: A servlet engine is not part of the Network Server.

seg-source.mrk: A servlet engine is not part of the Network Server.

target.mrk: A servlet engine is not part of the Network Server.

trans-unit.source: When the Network Server is started by the servlet interface, shutting down the Application Server also shuts the Network Server down, since both run in the same JVM.

seg-source.mrk: When the Network Server is started by the servlet interface, shutting down the Application Server also shuts the Network Server down, since both run in the same JVM.

target.mrk: When the Network Server is started by the servlet interface, shutting down the Application Server also shuts the Network Server down, since both run in the same JVM.

trans-unit.source: The servlet takes the following optional configuration parameters:

seg-source.mrk: The servlet takes the following optional configuration parameters:

target.mrk: The servlet takes the following optional configuration parameters:

trans-unit.source: host

seg-source.mrk: host

target.mrk: host

trans-unit.source: Specifies the host name to be used by the Network Server. See the Security Considerations section below.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the host name to be used by the Network Server.
See the Security Considerations section below.

target.mrk: Specifies the host name to be used by the Network Server.
See the Security Considerations section below.

trans-unit.source: portNumber

seg-source.mrk: portNumber

target.mrk: portNumber

trans-unit.source: Specifies the port number to be used by the Network Server.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the port number to be used by the Network Server.

target.mrk: Specifies the port number to be used by the Network Server.

trans-unit.source: startNetworkServerOnInit

seg-source.mrk: startNetworkServerOnInit

target.mrk: startNetworkServerOnInit

trans-unit.source: Specifies that the Network Server is to be started when the servlet is initialized.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies that the Network Server is to be started when the servlet is initialized.

target.mrk: Specifies that the Network Server is to be started when the servlet is initialized.

trans-unit.source: tracingDirectory

seg-source.mrk: tracingDirectory

target.mrk: tracingDirectory

trans-unit.source: Specifies the location for trace files. If the tracing directory is not specified, the traces are placed in <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the location for trace files.
If the tracing directory is not specified, the traces are placed in <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph>.

target.mrk: Specifies the location for trace files.
If the tracing directory is not specified, the traces are placed in <codeph>derby.system.home</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: Security Considerations

seg-source.mrk: Security Considerations

target.mrk: Security Considerations

trans-unit.source: For general security considerations for the Network Server, see <xref href="cadminnetservsecurity.dita"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: For general security considerations for the Network Server, see <xref href="cadminnetservsecurity.dita"></xref>.

target.mrk: For general security considerations for the Network Server, see <xref href="cadminnetservsecurity.dita"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>host</codeph> parameter allows configuration of the host name that will be used for the listening socket for network connections. By default, the Network Server will listen to requests only on the loopback address, which means that it will only accept connections from the local host. Changing this value could expose the server to external connections, which raises security concerns, so before using the <codeph>host</codeph> parameter, you should run under the Java security manager and enable user authentication.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>host</codeph> parameter allows configuration of the host name that will be used for the listening socket for network connections.
By default, the Network Server will listen to requests only on the loopback address, which means that it will only accept connections from the local host.

Changing this value could expose the server to external connections, which raises security concerns, so before using the <codeph>host</codeph> parameter, you should run under the Java security manager and enable user authentication.

target.mrk: The <codeph>host</codeph> parameter allows configuration of the host name that will be used for the listening socket for network connections.
By default, the Network Server will listen to requests only on the loopback address, which means that it will only accept connections from the local host.

Changing this value could expose the server to external connections, which raises security concerns, so before using the <codeph>host</codeph> parameter, you should run under the Java security manager and enable user authentication.

trans-unit.source: This section describes the servlet pages.

seg-source.mrk: This section describes the servlet pages.

target.mrk: This section describes the servlet pages.
